<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file implements float type expansion and softening for LegalizeTypes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Softening is the act of turning a computation in an illegal floating point</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// type into a computation in an integer type of the same size; also known as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;soft float&quot;.  For example, turning f32 arithmetic into operations using i32.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The resulting integer value is the same as what you would get by performing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the floating point operation and bitcasting the result to the integer type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Expansion is the act of changing a computation in an illegal type to be a</span></CodeLine>
